properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 3,000 particpants are expected to take part in this year's Bobbin Head Cycle Classic. Events start and finish at Karuah Oval in Turramurra, from 6:30am. All events will finish by 1:30pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm, including on sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, General San Martin Dr, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah, St Ives and Terry Hills. 

Speed limit reductions will be in effect at key locations at various times between 6am and 2pm.

A special event clearway will also be in place on the eastern side of a section of Mona Vale Rd in St Ives from 7am until 1:30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.otherAdvice:
The Spot Festival in Randwick on St Pauls Street and Perouse Road from 1pm until 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads in the area while crowds travel to and from the event, and road closures are in place. Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

From 4am, sections of Perouse Road and St Pauls Street will be closed until midnight. Motorists will be detoured via local roads. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in the area on sections of Perouse Road, St Pauls Street, Nancy Street and Soudan Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 370, 431 and 433 will be diverting around road closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Glebe Point Rd will be closed between Broadway and St Johns Rd from 9am to 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Norton St, Mitchell St, Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl and Francis St will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists can detour around the closures via St Johns Rd and Derwent St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 2pm).
  • EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 8pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)

  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)

  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

Freestyle Kings at McDonald Jones Stadium. Starts at 6:30pm, finish by 8:30pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the show.

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time on the Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd and Lambton Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Guineas Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Collingwood FC at GIANTS Stadium from 7:30pm to 10:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Giants Stadium at Sydney Olympic Park. Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd..

Fans who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night beofre the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Central Coast Mariners at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Western United at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm, full time around 9:40pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during busy Friday evening peak. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Highlanders at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7:35pm, full time around 9:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park in Friday evening peak as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 3pm).
  • EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

NRL: Knights v Raiders at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off from 8pm, finish around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium in Thursday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Melbourne Demons at the SCG. First bounce 7:30pm. End at 10:10pm.

More than 40,000 fans are expected to attend the the Swans opening game against Melbourne Demons on Thursday evening. Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match during the busy evening peak. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions will be in place:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 4:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Six Foot Track Marathon is a 45km trail stretching across the Blue Mountains from the Explorer's marked tree near Katoomba to the Jenolan Caves. The Marathon started in 1984 and follows the length of the entire trail. Due to road closure for the event please use detour.

Reduced speed limits and Traffic Controllers in place along the closed section of Jenolan Caves Road at Duckmaloi Road, Boggy Creek Road / Black Range Trail, the Six Foot Track Crossing, and Jenolan Cottages. Left turn off the Great Western Highway into Nellies Glen Road at Katoomba will also be closed for a short duration during the morning of the event.
properties.diversions: Detour via Jenolan Caves Rd, Duckmaloi Rd, Oberon St, Edith Rd to travel between Hartley and Jenolan via Oberon.

properties.otherAdvice:
Fox Superflow Mountain Bike event is coming to Narooma on Saturday 9 and Sunday 10 March.

A speed reduction will be in place on the Princes Hwy at Mitchells Ridge Rd.

The Hayland Gathering will be held at the Hay Park, following a street parade leaving

from The Hay Visitor Centre.

Lachlan St will be closed between Brunker St and Cadell St, motorist will be detoured via Brunker St, Pine St and Murray St.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Bulldogs at CommBank Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 3:05pm. NRL kick-off at at 5:30pm and full time around 7:15pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close after the match from 7.15pm to 8.15pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFC Cup Final: Central Coast Mariners v Odisha FC. Gates open (east side only) at 6pm. Match kicks off at 7pm, full time around 8:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match in the busy evening peak.  

Allow extra travel time the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 5pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

The Newcastle Show is a three day annual event taking place at Newcastle Showground, Broadmeadow from 9am Friday 1 March.

To assist with traffic movements, there will be no right or left hand turns from Griffiths Road into the showground on show days.

Signage and traffic control will be in place.

properties.publicTransport: Bus services may be modified or diverting, and some stops will be missed. Allow extra travel time.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures have been implemented by police at the following locations:

St James Rd – between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St (Both Directions)

Elizabeth St – between Hunter St and Park St (Southbound)

Elizabeth St – Between Park St and King St (Northbound)

Castlereagh St – Between King St and Market St

Market St – Between Elizabeth St and Clarence St (Eastbound)

Market St – Between Clarence St and York St (Westbound)

Druitt St – Between George St and Kent St

properties.otherAdvice:
The Goulburn Show will take place from Saturday 2 March to Sunday 3 March.

A speed reduction will be in place on Braidwood Rd and Bungonia Rd.

Motorists are advised to exercise caution with increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport:
There will be additional services departing Albion Park Station to Bondi Junction at 2.55pm, 3.30pm and 4.50pm, these services will stop at Dapto, Unanderra, Coniston, Wollongong, North Wollongong, Thirroul, Helensburgh, Waterfall, Sutherland, Hurstville, Wolli Creek, Redfern, Central then all stations to Bondi Junction.

Shellharbour Airport is opposite the station on the Princes Highway, special arrangements will be in place to assist the movement of pedestrians across the highway. Patrons should follow the direction of event staff on site.
properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic will be heavy on approaches to Shellharbour Airport during the event. Road closures and changed traffic conditions will be implemented in the area and motorists attending the event are advised to use the designated car park. The airport car park will only be accessible by VIP, Gold Pass and Wings Pavilion ticket holders.

Pre-paid event parking will be available at Albion Oval with a free shuttle bus to and from the event entrance gate.

Albion Park Station is less than 100m from the airport so leave the car at home and catch a train to the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Women: Central Coast Mariners v Adelaide United. Kick-off at 4pm, full time around 5:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 2:30pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Buses are replacing Metro services on Sunday. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Red Hot Summer Tour at Bella Vista Farm. First act from 12:20pm, finish around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the festival, particularly at the start and the end of the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Norwest Blvd, Elizabeth MacArthur Dr and Westwood Way.

Exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

SummerSalt music festival will be held at Speers Point Park on Saturday 9 March, with traffic control and changed conditions in place between 9:30am and 11:30pm.

Main Street will be closed to northbound traffic at the end of the event, with detours in place.

Signalised pedestrian crossing will be in place on the Esplanade.

Motorists should expect delays when travelling to and from the event and be mindful of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Parking is limited.

properties.publicTransport: Route 308 buses will be diverting around Redfern St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Redfern Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, George St and Glover Ln will also be closed during this time.
  • Pitt St will remain open to allow traffic to cross Redfern St.
  • Motorists travelling west will be detoured via Chalmers St, Cleveland St and Regent St.
  • Motorists travelling east will be detoured via Regent St, Botany Rd and Raglan St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • George St* between Turner St and Redfern St

  • Glover Ln* between Turner St and Redfern St

*Resident access maintained.

Note: Pitt St will remain open in both directions crossing Redfern St

If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Harris St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures will be in place from 9am until11:30pm on:

  • Harris St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and John St
  • Miller St between Little Mount St and Harris St
  • Miller St between Saunders St and Little Mount Street (eastbound)
  • Union St between Harris St and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders St between exit of Saunders St and Miller St (eastbound)
  • Motorists will be detoured via Pyrmont St and John St.

Special event clearwayswill be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Harris St and Miller St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

PYRMONT

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Harris Street 1 between Pyrmont Bridge Road and John Street
  • Miller Street between Little Mount Street and Harris Street
  • Miller Street 2 between Saunders Street and Little Mount Street (eastbound)
  • Union Street between Harris Street and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders Street 3 between exit of Saunders Street and Miller Street (eastbound)

Notes

1. Resident Access between John St and Union Square under traffic control

2. Resident Access Permitted

3. Resident Access between Saunders Street and Miller Street under traffic control

 

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Harris Street between Pyrmont Bridge Road and John Street
  • Miller Street between Little Mount Street and Harris Street
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special event clearways

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Nights markets will be held on Haldon Street, The Boulevard and Railway Parade in Lakemba every Thursday to Sunday, 6pm-3am from 9 March to 8 April.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly during the busy weeknight peaks on Thursdays and Fridays during the event.

Changed traffic conditions will be in place each night, motorists should allow plenty of extra time

Road closures from 5pm to 3am each night from 9 March to 8 April.  

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, and event shuttle buses will run from Caringbah, Cronulla and Woolooware train stations before and after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Bulldogs at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. NSW Cup from 3:45pm. NRL kick-off at 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match in the busy Friday evening peak. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Adelaide United at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm, finish around 9:45pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match during the busy Friday evening peak.

Allow extra travel time on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in race day tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ladies Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A special event clearway will be in place on Grand Ave from 6am to 8pm from 100m prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North (southern side/ westbound direction).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby double header at Allianz Stadium. Waratahs women v Brumbies at 5:05pm. Waratahs men v Blues at 7:35pm, full time around 9:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match. A music event will also be held next door in the Entertainment Quarter.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 4:30pm).
  • EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK – 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Eels at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off at 8:05pm, full time approx. 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium in the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Roosters at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick-off from 4:05pm, full-time around 6:05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v North Melbourne at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce at 4:30pm, finish approx 7:20pm.

Traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct with a combined crowd of up to 80,000 expected in the precinct as the P!NK concert also takes place at neighbouring Accor Stadium.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park, including on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Parking in the precinct is limited and expected to sell out. Please note, P6 car park is not available for this event.

Attendees who need to drive must pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - there will be no casual parking available on concert nights.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

Note: Easter Show infrastructure and fencing is in place. Follow directions and signage as walking routes around the precinct have changed.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run for the concert. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
P!NK Summer Carnival tour at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open 5pm, show starts at 7:30pm, finishes around 10:55pm.

Combined crowds of up to 80,000 are expected in the precinct across the evening as the AFL also takes place at nearby GIANTS Stadium.

Traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • Parking in the precinct is limited and is selling fast. Concertgoers must pre-book parking online to secure a space. Please note, P6 car park is not available for this event.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there will be no parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

Note: Easter Show infrastructure and fencing is in place. Follow directions and signage as walking routes around the precinct have changed.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

From 1:30am Friday 8 March to 1:30am Wednesday 10 April

  • Olympic Boulevard from 100m north of Dawn Fraser Avenue (adjacent to Cathy Freeman Park amenities) to 200m south of Edwin Flack Avenue (outside Qudos Bank Arena)
  • Australia Avenue from Murray Rose Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Grand Parade
  • Grand Parade from Olympic Boulevard to Australia Avenue

From 1.30am on Friday 22 March to 1:30am Tuesday 3 April 

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link
  • Marjorie Jackson Parkway from Wentworth Common car park to Australia Avenue 
  • Olympic Boulevard from Kevin Coombs Avenue to Sarah Durack Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15 (fixed closure) and Park Street 
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Edwin Flack Avenue to Showground Road
  • Shirley Strickland Avenue from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard
  • Shirley Strickland Avenue from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland Avenue to the Tennis Centre.
  • Shane Gould Avenue at P2 car park
